line_1: Where (my dire emblem) a rapacious Kite
line_2: But ah! in smiles no more they met my sight,

line_1: Thus to condemn a hawk or kite,
line_2: O impudence of power and might,

line_1: Must pay obeisance to this Kite;
line_2: Then all that had a claim, or right,

line_1: With winning grace the artful Kite,
line_2: Promis'd to aid the soldier's right;
Thus said, she took an instant flight.
